elements.title: Zénith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the two victims of the Zénith balloon incident are depicted holding hands on their tomb (pictured)?

elements.title: Lionel Haward (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lionel Haward applied an early example of offender profiling to help identify high-ranking Nazis disguised as ordinary troops?

elements.title: Until Then (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the adventure game Until Then has an in-universe version of Facebook where the player can like and comment on other characters' posts?

elements.title: Lisa M. Corrigan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lisa M. Corrigan used the prison memoirs of black activists to show how incarceration impacted the black power movement?

elements.title: a shipwreck in the eastern Mediterranean (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a shipwreck in the eastern Mediterranean, dating from the Late Bronze Age, is the earliest deep-sea shipwreck to be discovered?

elements.title: Johann Joseph Dömling (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Johann Joseph Dömling suggested in 1803 that venous blood contained carbon monoxide?

elements.title: Togo's abortion law (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Togo's abortion law was one of the first in Africa to allow abortion in the case of rape?

elements.title: Dissolution Grip (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dissolution Grip by KMRU uses recordings of the artist's shack being struck by strong winds?

elements.title: headless priest (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that, according to a local myth, a headless priest cursed León Viejo with earthquakes?
